metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5118 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The screenshot images displayed in the Activity Stream page displayed when a new tab is opened is created from the meta tags of websites. An issue was discovered where the page could attempt to create these images through "file:" URLs from the local file system. This loading is blocked by the sandbox but could expose local data if combined with another attack that escapes sandbox protections. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 58.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5118` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
